sen.j: 三条西 季知（さんじょうにし すえとも、文化 (元号)8年2月26日 (旧暦)（1811年3月20日） - 明治13年（1880年）8月24日）は、幕末の公卿で明治の高官。
sen.e: Suetomo SANJONISHI (March 20th, 1811 ~ August 24th, 1880) was a Kugyo (a court noble of some class) of the end of Edo period and a High official of the Meiji Era.

sen.j: 安政5年（1858年）、権中納言となり重んじられるが、文久3年（1863年）公武合体派の策略により、三条実美らと長州へ下向、いわゆる七卿落ちの一人となる。
sen.e: He was appointed to Gonchunagon (provisional middle counselor) in 1858, and trusted, however, he was obliged to leave the capital to Choshu by a conspiracy by those who advocate shogunate marital union with the Imperial Family, a man of so-called "Shichikyo ochi" (incident that seven Kugyo was expelled from Kyoto).

He was appointed to Gonchunagon (provisional middle counselor) in 1858, and trusted, however, he was obliged to leave the capital to Choshu in a conspiracy by those who advocated shogunate marital union with the Imperial Family, a man of so-called "Shichikyo ochi" (incident when seven Kugyo were expelled from Kyoto).

He was appointed to Gon chunagon (Provisional vice-councilor) in 1858, and trusted, however, he was obliged to leave the capital to Choshu in a conspiracy by those who advocated kobu-gattai (integration of the imperial court and the shogunate), and thereby became a man of so-called Shichikyo ochi (the exile of the Seven nobles from Kyoto) in 1863.

sen.j: その後さらに太宰府まで走り、やがて王政復古の大号令によって赦され、帰京。
sen.e: Further, he escaped to Dazaifu and was granted amnesty by the command of restoration of imperial rule, and returned home to Kyoto.
Further, he escaped to Dazaifu and was granted amnesty by the command restorating imperial rule, and returned home to Kyoto.
Further, he escaped to Dazaifu (local government office in Kyushu region) and was granted amnesty by the Decree for the Restoration of Imperial Rule, and returned home to Kyoto.

sen.j: 明治維新後、大納言、参与、神宮祭主となった。
sen.e: After the Meiji restoration, he was designated to Dainagon (chief councilor of state), Sanyo (councilor) and Jingu saishu (head priest of the Ise Shrine).

sen.j: 三条西家の当主だけあって歌道の宗匠として知られ、西四辻公業（大坂府知事）とともに明治天皇の歌道師範としても有名である。
sen.e: As he was a family head of the Sanjonishi family, he was known as a master of tanka poetry, and it is also famous that he was an instructor of tanka poetry of the Emperor Meiji as well as Kiminari NISHIYOTSUTSUJI (Governor of Osaka Prefecture).

sen.j: 季知自身は高松公祐に師事した。
